title: Distributing AppleSeed disguised as Internet router installation file

sentences: AppleSeed (1) : regsvr32.exe /s C:\ProgramData\Firmware\Microsoft\Windows\Defender\AutoUpdate.dll<crlf>AppleSeed (2) : regsvr32.exe /s /n /i:123qweASDTYU C:\ProgramData\Software\ControlSet\Service\ServiceScheduler.dll

[IOC]<crlf>MD5<crlf>(1) firmware upgrade installer.exe (39b39ca9cbf9b271590d06dfc68a68b7)<crlf>Dropper/Win.AppleSeed.C5150014 (2022.05.30.02)<crlf>(2) firmware upgrade installer.exe (851e33373114fef45d0fe28c6934fa73)<crlf>Dropper/Win.AppleSeed.C5145023 (2022.05.27.02)<crlf>(3) wmi-ui-99bbc08f.db (9ac572bdca96a833a40edcaa91e04c2b)<crlf>Backdoor/Win.AppleSeed.C5145022 (2022.05.30.02)<crlf>(4) asd.dat (6b10482c939fc33c3a45a17f021df32b), ServiceScheduler.dll (c99f6d1c7c0d55ce1453dd08c87ee2b4)<crlf>Backdoor/Win.AppleSeed.C5145020 (2022.05.27.02)
AppleSeed Anti Sandbox , DllInstall() /s /i .

As for how the EXE executable file works, when the user runs the file, a pop-up window disguised as the firmware upgrade installation of a specific router occurs as shown below. ( It has nothing to do with the router firmware and AppleSeed malware. ) For reference, in the case of disguised document files in the past, the documents and picture files are popped up when executed, disguised to appear as if the user executed the document or picture normally.
AppleSeed , ASD AppleSeed .

The ASEC analysis team caught the situation where the AppleSeed malware was disguised as a router firmware installer on May 26th. AppleSeed, known so far, was mainly distributed under the guise of normal document files or picture files. The dropper malware that creates AppleSeed uses a script format such as JS (Java Script) and VBS (Visual Basic Script), or even an executable file has a pif extension disguised as a document file. Disguised icons and file names were used.
PC AppleSeed . AppleSeed C&C . PC RDP Patcher, HVNC, TightVNC .
AppleSeed Kimsuky APT ASEC .

VBS scripts disguised as PDF documents (Kimsuky) ASEC BLOG<crlf><crlf>The ASEC analysis team confirmed today (03/23) that the attack group presumed to be the Kimsuky organization is performing APT attacks on specific domestic companies. When the VBS extension script file is executed, the normal PDF file existing inside is executed to deceive as if reading a normal document, and information leakage function is performed through the malicious DLL file. When looking at the contents of the PDF document, the attack target is estimated to be a precision processing company, and the contents of the PDF document are as follows. File name: Receipt - Small and Medium Business Technology Innovation Development Project_Market Expansion_Green Conversion_S???????.pdf.vbs
Tagged as: AppleSeed , Kimsuky

The ASEC analysis team caught the situation where the AppleSeed malware was disguised as a router firmware installer on May 26th. AppleSeed, known so far, was mainly distributed under the guise of normal document files or picture files. The dropper malware that creates AppleSeed uses a script format such as JS (Java Script) and VBS (Visual Basic Script), or even an executable file has a pif extension disguised as a document file. Disguised icons and file names were used.

sentences: If you click the OK button in the pop-up window, the EXE internally transmits iptime.com to the ShellExecuteExW API as an API parameter, so that it looks as if the firmware update is in progress normally and accessing the manufacturers website.

VBS scripts disguised as PDF documents (Kimsuky) ASEC BLOG<crlf><crlf>The ASEC analysis team confirmed today (03/23) that the attack group presumed to be the Kimsuky organization is performing APT attacks on specific domestic companies. When the VBS extension script file is executed, the normal PDF file existing inside is executed to deceive as if reading a normal document, and information leakage function is performed through the malicious DLL file. When looking at the contents of the PDF document, the attack target is estimated to be a precision processing company, and the contents of the PDF document are as follows. File name: Receipt - Small and Medium Business Technology Innovation Development Project_Market Expansion_Green Conversion_S???????.pdf.vbs

As for how the EXE executable file works, when the user runs the file, a pop-up window disguised as the firmware upgrade installation of a specific router occurs as shown below. ( It has nothing to do with the router firmware and AppleSeed malware. ) For reference, in the case of disguised document files in the past, the documents and picture files are popped up when executed, disguised to appear as if the user executed the document or picture normally.

As for how the EXE executable file works, when the user runs the file, a pop-up window disguised as the firmware upgrade installation of a specific router occurs as shown below. ( It has nothing to do with the router firmware and AppleSeed malware. ) For reference, in the case of disguised document files in the past, the documents and picture files are popped up when executed, disguised to appear as if the user executed the document or picture normally.

If you click the OK button in the pop-up window, the EXE internally transmits iptime.com to the ShellExecuteExW API as an API parameter, so that it looks as if the firmware update is in progress normally and accessing the manufacturers website.
Kimsuky APT (AppleSeed, PebbleDash) ASEC BLOG<crlf><crlf>Kimsuky . Kimsuky , . ASD , . IT ,
